stanza.line: Whilst I alone did call upon thy (a)aid(/a)
My verse alone had all thy gentle (b)grace(/b)
But now my gracious numbers are (a)decayed(/a)
And my sick muse doth give an other (b)place(/b)
Deserves the travail of a worthier (d)pen(/d)
Yet what of thee thy poet doth (c)invent(/c)
He robs thee of and pays it thee (d)again(/d)
He lends thee virtue and he stole that (e)word(/e)
From thy behaviour beauty doth he (f)give(/f)
And found it in thy cheek he can (e)afford(/e)
No praise to thee but what in thee doth (f)live(/f)
Then thank him not for that which he doth (g)say(/g)
Since what he owes thee thou thy self dost (g)pay(/g)
